info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 15 at 2:26PM MDT until April 17 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM SATURDAY TO NOON MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches, highest at pass level. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Lewis and Clark County and the Rocky Mountain Front. This does not include the Helena area. * WHEN...From 3 PM Saturday to Noon MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Accumulating snow on roads should primarily be confined to areas above 5000 feet elevation during the mid- to late afternoon hours Saturday. Additional light snow is expected Sunday afternoon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
